title: BioDiesel, it's time to switch... or is it?
body: Yes it is.  If you haven't been inspired by the <a href="http://www.wired.com/news/autotech/0,2554,63635,00.html">recent Wired article</a>, <a href="http://www.syracuse.com/business/poststandard/index.ssf?/base/business-5/1086079037318550.xml">your local newspaper</a>, or <a href="http://news.google.com/news?q=biodiesel">any other article</a>, now's the time to switch.  Whether your converting <a href="http://www.transmitmedia.com/golfTDI/">a car</a>, <a href="http://esf.uvm.edu/envcncl/referlibrary/biodiesel.html">a bus</a>, or <a href="http://www.thehindubusinessline.com/2004/05/27/stories/2004052700190300.htm">even a train</a>, I can guarantee you'll be happy with the mileage.  There's <a href="http://www.google.com/search?q=biodiesel">tons of info out there</a> (and <a href="http://www.feedster.com/search.php?q=biodiesel">tons of opinions too</a>).  Aside from the <a href="http://www.energea.at/en_info2.html">enormous environmental benefits</a> (better mileage than gasoline, produced from renewable materials, contains practically no sulfur, decreases soot emissions, etc.), it also <a href="http://www.nyserda.org/press/2002/aug19_02.html">benefits farmers</a>, which we've got plenty of in this state.  It's something to think about while you're saving for that <a href="http://www.toyota.com/prius/">Prius</a>, or waiting for <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/archive/2004/05/17/GM_Hy_Wire.aspx">HyWire</a> to get here.<br/><br/>[Edit]: somehow I managed to miss a <a href="http://slashdot.org/article.pl?sid=04/06/01/1729255">recent /. article</a> on this very subject.  It only costs the dude $0.41/gallon!
bodyArticleHtml:
2004-06-02
